com.google.publicalerts.cap

Class XmlSignatureValidator.Result

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.publicalerts.cap.XmlSignatureValidator.Result
  • Enclosing class:
    XmlSignatureValidator

    public static class XmlSignatureValidator.Result extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the result a call to XmlSignatureValidator.validate(java.lang.String).

    To determine whether the XML signature was valid, use isSignatureValid().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  XmlSignatureValidator.Result.Detail 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<XmlSignatureValidator.Result.Detail> details()
      Returns zero or more details to elaborate on the reason for validation failure (if isSignatureValid() is false), or things we permitted because TrustStrategy allowed leniency (if isSignatureValid() is true.
      boolean isSignatureValid()
      Determines whether the XML document contained a valid XML signature signed by a trusted key as defined by TrustStrategy.isKeyTrusted(java.security.PublicKey) - if so, return true.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isSignatureValid

        public boolean isSignatureValid()
        Determines whether the XML document contained a valid XML signature signed by a trusted key as defined by TrustStrategy.isKeyTrusted(java.security.PublicKey) - if so, return true.

        If the signature was valid but key was not trusted, return true iff TrustStrategy.allowUntrustedCredentials() is true.

        If the signature was missing or a suitable validation Key could not be found, return true iff TrustStrategy.allowMissingSignatures() is true.

        Otherwise, return false.

      • details

        public java.util.Set<XmlSignatureValidator.Result.Detail> details()
        Returns zero or more details to elaborate on the reason for validation failure (if isSignatureValid() is false), or things we permitted because TrustStrategy allowed leniency (if isSignatureValid() is true.
